item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: US accuses Abiy's government of blocking aid
item.description: Washington's aid chief says food is set to run out, with hundreds of thousands at risk of famine,

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 13-19 August 2021
item.description: A selection of the best photos from the African continent and beyond.

item.title: How could Africa produce its own vaccines?
item.description: For decades, Africa has imported 99% of its vaccines. So how could it jumpstart local vaccine manufacturing?

item.title: Spain migrants: Sole survivor rescued in dinghy in Atlantic
item.description: The woman, who was spotted clinging to an upturned boat, says at least 52 other people died.

item.title: Zimbabwe arrests after child bride dies giving birth at church shrine
item.description: Anna Machaya's death at a church leads to calls for the government to end forced child marriage.

item.title: Tigray crisis: Ethiopian teenagers become pawns in propaganda war
item.description: The BBC is told they were forced to fight for Tigray's rebels, but were words put into their mouths?

item.title: Algeria: The forest fires that led to an artist's lynching
item.description: When Djamel Ben Ismail went to fight forest fires in Algeria, his life was cut short by a raging mob.

item.title: How latte art in South Africa led to a job from hell in Oman
item.description: A South African barista was offered a dream opportunity in Oman but unknowingly signed away his freedoms.

item.title: Nigeria's Kano state moves to ban mannequin heads on Islamic grounds
item.description: The Islamic police in Kano, Nigeria, say shop dummies with heads symbolise "idolatry" and are banned.

item.title: Ethiopia: What do we know about aid going into Tigray?
item.description: Who's preventing desperately needed aid supplies reaching Ethiopia's Tigray region?

item.title: Viewpoint: Why Twitter got it wrong in Nigeria
item.description: Complex issues have been raised about policing speech and censoring unpopular voices.

item.title: Dutch medallist - no regrets about quitting Ethiopia
item.description: Dutch triple Olympic medallist Sifan Hassan has no regrets over leaving Ethiopia and calls for peace to stop more athletes following suit.

item.title: Nigeria's Lai Mohammed: We are winning the war against Boko Haram
item.description: The information minister says Nigeria is winning the war against insecurity and is negotiating with Twitter over the ban.

item.title: South African entrepreneur builds a brand against gangsterism
item.description: Roemello Shembe, 21, is building a business in one of Johannesburgâ€™s most challenging townships.

item.title: Zambia elections: Hakainde Hichilema supporters celebrate victory
item.description: People take to the streets following Hakainde Hichilema's landslide victory in Zambia's presidential elections.

item.title: Wildfires rage in Algeria as heatwave hits North Africa
item.description: The blazes in the mountainous Kabylie region are some of the worst in the country's history.

item.title: The illegal gold mines killing rivers and livelihoods in Ghana
item.description: Sixty percent of Ghana's water bodies are now polluted, largely due to illegal mining operations.

item.title: Tanzania: President Samia Suluhu Hassan on leadership, Covid-19 and democracy
item.description: Tanzania's president says there were people who doubted she was qualified.

item.title: Telfar Clemens: Designer creates Tokyo 2020 Olympic outfits for Team Liberia
item.description: American-Liberian designer Telfar Clemens created Liberian team's outfits at the Tokyo Olympics.
